Shoppers flock to Westfield UTC as more stores open in San Diego ...  their dogs and chased toddlers around the retail plaza. Queues of customers lined up outside popular spots such as The Apple Store and Pottery Barn, standing on circular mats marking 6 feet of distance between shoppers. People basked in the common areas, occasionally lifting their face coverings to take sips of coffee as they talked. Faye Longmaker and Amy Talmadge, two friends and longtime coworkers at Qualcomm, sat 6 feet apart under a shade tree, each in a homemade fabric mask. Before the days of the pandemic, the duo had a tradition of taking a weekend art class together, followed by a chatty breakfast at the Corner Bakery Caf. Now, they each work from home. No chatting in the hallways. No weekend art classes. "Zoom just isn't the same," ...
